alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 10:16PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Norton, northern Decatur and southern Red Willow Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1016 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southwest of Lebanon, or 15 miles northeast of Oberlin, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Norton, northern Decatur and southern Red Willow Counties, including the following locations... Traer and Cedar Bluffs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
